align.description: Determines the alignment of the text inside the input.
align.name: align

autocomplete.description:
Determines if browser form autocomplete is enabled.
Note that "one-time-code" is experimental and should not be used without
consultation. "address-line1" and "address-line2" are
used for billing address information.
autocomplete.name: autocomplete

autofocus.description: Determines if the input should be auto-focused, using the HTML attribute
autofocus.name: autofocus

clearable.description:
Add a clear action on the input that clears the value.

You should always use `while-editing` if you want the input to be
clearable. if the input value isn't editable (i.e. `InputTime`) you can
set it to `always`.
clearable.name: clearable

defaultValue.description:
Initial value of the input. Only use this when you need to pre-populate
the field with a data that is not controlled by the components state. If a
state is controlling the value, use the `value` prop instead.
defaultValue.name: defaultValue

description.description: Further description of the input, can be used for a hint.
description.name: description

id.description: A unique identifier for the input.
id.name: id

inline.description:
Adjusts the form field to go inline with a content. This also silences the
given `validations` prop. You'd have to used the `onValidate` prop to
capture the message and render it somewhere else using the
`InputValidation` component.
inline.name: inline

invalid.description: Highlights the field red to indicate an error.
invalid.name: invalid

keyboard.description: Determines what kind of keyboard appears on mobile web.
keyboard.name: keyboard

loading.description: Show a spinner to indicate loading
loading.name: loading

maxLength.description:
Maximum character length for an input. This also changes the width to
roughly the same size as the max length. This is to communicate that the
user that on certain cases, they can only type a limited amount of
characters.
maxLength.name: maxLength

multiline.description: Use this when you're expecting a long answer.
multiline.name: multiline

onChange.name: onChange

type.name: ((newValue: string | number | boolean | Date, event?: ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement | HTMLTextAreaElement | HTMLSelectElement>) => void)

onEnter.description:
A callback to handle "Enter" keypress. This will only run
if Enter is the only key. Will not run if Shift or Control
are being held.
onEnter.name: onEnter

onValidation.description:
Callback to get the the status and message when validating a field
@param message
onValidation.name: onValidation

placeholder.description:
Text that appears inside the input when empty and floats above the value
as a mini label once the user enters a value.
When showMiniLabel is false, this text only serves as a standard placeholder and
disappears when the user types.
placeholder.name: placeholder

prefix.description: Adds a prefix label and icon to the field
prefix.name: prefix

readonly.description: Prevents users from editing the value.
readonly.name: readonly

ref.name: ref

rows.description:
Specifies the visible height of a long answer form field. Can be in the
form of a single number to set a static height, or an object with a min
and max keys indicating the minimum number of visible rows, and the
maximum number of visible rows.
rows.name: rows

showMiniLabel.description:
Controls the visibility of the mini label that appears inside the input
when a value is entered. By default, the placeholder text moves up to
become a mini label. Set to false to disable this behavior.
showMiniLabel.name: showMiniLabel

size.description: Adjusts the interface to either have small or large spacing.
size.name: size

suffix.description: Adds a suffix label and icon with an optional action to the field
suffix.name: suffix

type.name: { onClick: () => void; readonly ariaLabel: string; readonly icon: IconNames; readonly label?: string; } | { onClick?: undefined; ariaLabel?: undefined; readonly label?: string; readonly icon?: IconNames | undefined; } | undefined

toolbar.description: Toolbar to render content below the input.
toolbar.name: toolbar

toolbarVisibility.description: Determines the visibility of the toolbar.
toolbarVisibility.name: toolbarVisibility

validations.description:
Show an error message above the field. This also
highlights the the field red if an error message shows up.
validations.name: validations

value.description: Set the component to the given value.
value.name: value

version.description:
Experimental:
Determine which version of the FormField to use.
Right now this isn't used but it will be used in the future
to allow us to release new versions of our form inputs without breaking existing functionality.
version.name: version
